recommendations: Prioritize a focused CT Angiography of the Chest to specifically evaluate the thoracic aorta, minimizing contrast volume compared to a full torso trauma scan.
Administer 500-1000 mL of isotonic intravenous fluid pre-contrast to support renal perfusion and hemodynamics given the profound hypotension (MAP 49.3 mmHg).
Utilize a low-contrast volume protocol (e.g., 80 mL total) with a split-bolus technique for the CTA.
Perform post-contrast serum creatinine and eGFR assessment at 24-48 hours to monitor for any contrast-induced nephropathy.
rationale: The primary clinical concern is injury to the thoracic aorta, making a focused CTA more appropriate than a broad trauma scan, thereby reducing contrast exposure.
The patient's severe hypotension necessitates proactive measures to mitigate contrast-related risks and support hemodynamic stability.
Minimizing contrast volume is crucial in hemodynamically compromised patients to reduce potential nephrotoxicity.
Post-contrast renal function monitoring is essential in at-risk patients to detect early signs of kidney injury.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully.
protocol_selection.modifications_suggested: Reduce contrast volume to 80 mL using a split-bolus technique. Timing remains critical for aortic opacification.

protocol_selection.name: Trauma CT — Chest, Abdomen & Pelvis with Contrast
protocol_selection.description: Contrast CT of torso with trauma-focused reformats; may include delayed images as needed.
protocol_selection.contrast_timing: Portal venous phase, possible delayed imaging to assess hemorrhage.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Standard contrast dose; trauma protocols may include split bolus techniques.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Minimize field-of-view and dose; use alternative imaging if stable and renal risk high.
protocol_selection.modifications_suggested: Consider as a secondary option if additional abdominal/pelvic injury is suspected. If utilized, reduce contrast volume proportionally and consider omitting delayed imaging unless clearly indicated.
